feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a system component that automatically calculates and deducts daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave. It determines the appropriate salary reduction by dividing the total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month. The calculator accounts for public holidays by subtracting them from the working day count, and supports both calendar day-based (e.g., 30 days) and working day-based (e.g., 22 days) leave policies. Upon approval of an unpaid leave request, the system automatically generates a pay deduction that is reflected on the payroll table. This ensures accurate and consistent salary calculations across the organization.

job_to_be_done.content: Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days in the month

Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages, including salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions, with options to select calculation bases and salary components.
Allow super admins to configure and customize leave encashment policies for end-of-service calculations, including selection of salary components and calculation methods.
To calculate and manage unpaid leave deductions on a daily basis for employee payroll, allowing these deductions to be set off against the employee's monthly pay.
Adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement

primary_personas.content: HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave and salary calculations
Superadmin, Payroll table managers, and transaction processors who configure and manage daily wage calculations.
Super admins responsible for payroll and HR settings configuration.
Super Admins who have the flexibility to configure unpaid deduction calculations when adding new leave policies.

navigation_paths.content: Access the Daily Wage Calculator from Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation.
Access the Daily Wage Calculator via Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure.
Settings → Leaves → Leave Policies → Add policy → Selecting Unpaid leave option to configure daily rate calculation.

prerequisites.content: An approved unpaid leave request must exist before daily pay deduction is calculated and reflected on the payroll table
Company's public holiday calendar must be set up to exclude weekends and public holidays from working days calculations.
Super admin role and access to payroll settings configuration.
Access to Leave Settings and the ability to add or modify leave policies as a Super Admin.
Access to payroll configuration as a Super admin; active payroll system with employee salary data

data_inputs_required.content: Employee's total salary (basic salary plus allowance), number of working days in the month, number of calendar days in the month (if using calendar day policy), public holidays falling in the month, and approved unpaid leave days
Selection of calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days) and choice of salary components to include (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only).
Selection of salary components (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), calculation method (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and eligible leave types for encashment.
Selection of calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) and day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days) when configuring unpaid leave deduction.
Selection of calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days

outputs_results.content: Automatic pay deduction associated with the unpaid leave request, reflected on the payroll table, and calculated daily pay rate derived from dividing salary by actual working days
Calculated daily wage rates that are applied to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations.
Customized leave encashment policy configuration that affects end-of-service calculations and visibility of which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten.
Configured unpaid leave deduction calculation that applies daily deductions to be set off against the employee's monthly pay.
Updated salary calculations that proportionally adjust employee compensation based on selected calculation method; changes applied to all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table

procedures.content: Process unpaid leave: receive unpaid leave request, approve leave request, determine leave policy (calendar days or working days), calculate total working days in the month, subtract public holidays from working days to arrive at actual working days, calculate daily pay by dividing salary amount by actual working days, and generate automatic payroll deduction
Navigate to Settings, select Payroll, choose Daily Wage Calculation, select a calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and choose salary components to factor into calculations.

Navigate to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure; select applicable salary components for leave encashment; choose calculation method (calendar days, working days, or custom days); configure individual leave types for end-of-service calculations.

Navigate to Settings, select Leaves, go to Leave Policies, add a new policy, select the Unpaid leave option, choose a calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), and select a day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days).

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. 2. Select calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days). 3. Save changes. 4. If payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, reject those transactions and then save the new proration settings.

rules_limitations_constraints.content: Daily pay is calculated by dividing total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days; the leave policy can be based on calendar days (e.g., 30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days); public holidays falling in the month must be deducted from working days to determine actual working days used in the calculation

Calculation can be based on calendar days (actual days in month, e.g., 31 in January, 28 in February), working days (excluding weekends and public holidays), or custom days (flexible, commonly set to 30 in UAE and KSA to comply with labor law).

Salary component selection limited to Basic Only or Basic + Allowances; calculation method options are calendar days, working days, or custom days; configuration applies to individual leave types for end-of-service eligibility.

Unpaid leave deductions must be calculated on a daily basis and set off against the employee's monthly pay. Configuration options are limited to Basic Only, Basic + Allowances for calculation methods, and Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days for day calculation types.

Changes to salary proration affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted for one or multiple employees, Super admin must reject the transactions before saving new proration settings.

edge_cases_warnings.content: Public holidays must be carefully identified and subtracted from the working day count when calculating daily pay; for example, if 2 days are public holidays in a 22-day working month, daily pay is calculated based on 20 days, not 22 days

Calculation varies depending on month length and selected calculation method; different calculation bases can significantly impact final wage calculations, particularly for salary proration and leave encashment.
Super admins can view which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten when applying new leave encashment configurations.
Multiple options exist for daily rate calculation including Basic Only and Basic + Allowances, requiring Super Admins to select the appropriate method based on organizational policy.
When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist, Super admin must manually reject and resave transactions to apply new salary proration settings

feature_interactions_dependencies.content: Interacts with the payroll system to automatically create and reflect pay deductions; integrates with leave management system to receive approved unpaid leave requests; depends on employee record systems for salary information and leave policy configuration
Interacts with Payroll settings, public holiday calendar configuration, salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction features to calculate accurate daily wage rates.
Interacts with Payroll settings, End of Service calculations, and Leave Management system to customize leave encashment policies and affect end-of-service calculation outcomes.
The daily wage calculator interacts with the payroll system by calculating daily deductions that are applied to monthly employee pay, similar to leave encashment functionality.
Interacts with Payroll system and payroll table; affects active payroll transactions and employee compensation calculations

glossary_terms.content: Daily pay: the amount calculated by dividing an employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month, used to determine deductions for unpaid leave ; Actual working days: the number of working days in a month after deducting public holidays; used as the divisor in daily pay calculation ; Calendar days leave policy: a leave policy based on calendar days (e.g., 30 days per month) rather than working days ; Working days leave policy: a leave policy based on actual working days (e.g., 22 days per month) excluding weekends and public holidays

Calendar days: the number of days in a given month (e.g., 31 in January, 28 in February). Working days: only business days counted, excluding weekends and public holidays. Custom days: flexible calculation base set according to company policies, commonly 30 days in UAE and KSA to align with labor law requirements.

Leave encashment: The process of converting accrued but unused leave into monetary compensation; End-of-service: Calculations performed when an employee separates from the organization; Daily Wage Calculator: Configuration tool for customizing leave encashment policies.

Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee that does not result in compensation and requires daily rate calculation for payroll deduction purposes. ; Daily rate calculation: The method used to determine the monetary value of leave on a per-day basis, with options including Basic Only, Basic + Allowances, and day type selections (Calendar days, Working days, Custom days).

DWC (Daily Wage Calculator): System component for configuring salary proration. Salary proration: Proportional adjustment of employee salary based on actual days worked. Calculation bases: Methods for determining prorated salary—custom days, calendar days, or working days.
